findings.title: Potentially unlimited indemnification
findings.rationale: Indemnity obligations may be uncapped, which can expose you to costs far beyond the contract value.

5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
Provider's liability is capped at the total contract value, except for indemnification obligations which are unlimited.

6. TERM AND TERMINATION
Either party may terminate immediately upon material breach by the other party.

7. CONFIDENTIALITY
Confidentiality obligations survive

findings.title: Liability cap carve-outs may negate protection
findings.rationale: Liability caps that exclude indemnity, confidentiality, or IP claims often negate the practical benefit of the cap entirely.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY Provider's liability is capped at the total contract value, except for indemnification obligations which are unlimited....
